SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.pop3.handler

Class DefaultPOP3Handler

java.lang.Object
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.pop3.handler.DefaultPOP3Handler
All Implemented Interfaces:
AuthorizationHandler, ClientConnected, TransactionHandler
public class DefaultPOP3Handler extends Object implements ClientConnected, AuthorizationHandler, TransactionHandler
Default POP3 handler implementation that accepts all operations.

This handler provides passthrough behaviour using the configured Realm and MailboxFactory. It accepts all connections, opens mailboxes for authenticated users, and performs all mailbox operations using the Mailbox API.

This handler is used as the default when no custom handler factory is configured on the server. Subclasses can override specific methods to add custom policy logic.

Behaviour:

  • Accepts all connections with a configurable greeting
  • Opens the INBOX for authenticated users
  • Permits all mailbox operations (STAT, LIST, RETR, DELE, etc.)
  • Commits deletions on QUIT
Author:
Chris Burdess
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • connected

      public void connected(ConnectionInfo info, ConnectedState state)
      Description copied from interface: ClientConnected
      Called when a new client connection is established.

      This is called immediately after the TCP connection is accepted and any TLS handshake is completed (for implicit TLS connections). The handler should evaluate whether to accept this connection and call the appropriate method on the state interface.

      The connection information includes:

      • Client and server socket addresses
      • TLS status and certificate information (if secure)

      To accept the connection, call state.acceptConnection() with a greeting message and the handler for the authorization state. To reject, call state.rejectConnection().

      Specified by:
      connected in interface ClientConnected
      Parameters:
      info - connection information (addresses, TLS status)
      state - operations available for responding

    • disconnected

      public void disconnected()
      Description copied from interface: ClientConnected
      Called when the connection is closed for any reason.

      This may be called at any point in the protocol if the client disconnects, the server closes the connection, or an error occurs. Implementations should clean up any per-connection resources.

      Specified by:
      disconnected in interface ClientConnected

    • authenticate

      public void authenticate(Principal principal, MailboxFactory mailboxFactory, AuthenticateState state)
      Description copied from interface: AuthorizationHandler
      Called after the Realm has authenticated a user.

      The connection has already verified credentials using the Realm. The handler now makes a policy decision on whether to allow access.

      To accept, open the user's mailbox using the factory and call AuthenticateState.accept(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mailbox.Mailbox, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.pop3.handler.TransactionHandler). To reject, call one of the reject methods on the state.

      Specified by:
      authenticate in interface AuthorizationHandler
      Parameters:
      principal - the authenticated principal from the Realm
      mailboxFactory - factory for opening the user's mailbox
      state - operations for accepting or rejecting

    • mailboxStatus

      public void mailboxStatus(Mailbox mailbox, MailboxStatusState state)
      Description copied from interface: TransactionHandler
      Called when the client requests mailbox status (STAT command).

      Returns the number of messages and total size of the mailbox.

      Specified by:
      mailboxStatus in interface TransactionHandler
      Parameters:
      mailbox - the user's mailbox
      state - operations for responding with statistics

    • list

      public void list(Mailbox mailbox, int messageNumber, ListState state)
      Description copied from interface: TransactionHandler
      Called when the client requests message listing (LIST command).

      Returns message numbers and their sizes. If a message number is provided, returns information for that message only; otherwise returns information for all messages.

      Specified by:
      list in interface TransactionHandler
      Parameters:
      mailbox - the user's mailbox
      messageNumber - the specific message number, or 0 for all messages
      state - operations for responding with the list

    • markDeleted

      public void markDeleted(Mailbox mailbox, int messageNumber, MarkDeletedState state)
      Description copied from interface: TransactionHandler
      Called when the client marks a message for deletion (DELE command).

      Marks the specified message for deletion. The message is not actually deleted until the session ends normally with QUIT.

      Specified by:
      markDeleted in interface TransactionHandler
      Parameters:
      mailbox - the user's mailbox
      messageNumber - the message number to delete
      state - operations for confirming the deletion

    • top

      public void top(Mailbox mailbox, int messageNumber, int lines, TopState state)
      Description copied from interface: TransactionHandler
      Called when the client requests message headers (TOP command).

      TOP retrieves the message headers and the first N lines of the message body (RFC 1939 Section 7).

      Specified by:
      top in interface TransactionHandler
      Parameters:
      mailbox - the user's mailbox
      messageNumber - the message number
      lines - the number of body lines to retrieve
      state - operations for sending the content

    • uidl

      public void uidl(Mailbox mailbox, int messageNumber, UidlState state)
      Description copied from interface: TransactionHandler
      Called when the client requests unique identifiers (UIDL command).

      Returns unique identifiers for messages. If a message number is provided, returns the UID for that message only; otherwise returns UIDs for all messages.

      Specified by:
      uidl in interface TransactionHandler
      Parameters:
      mailbox - the user's mailbox
      messageNumber - the specific message number, or 0 for all messages
      state - operations for responding with UIDs

    • quit

      public void quit(Mailbox mailbox, UpdateState state)
      Description copied from interface: TransactionHandler
      Called when the client ends the session (QUIT command).

      QUIT in TRANSACTION state transitions to UPDATE state, committing all deletions before closing the connection.

      Specified by:
      quit in interface TransactionHandler
      Parameters:
      mailbox - the user's mailbox (to commit deletions)
      state - operations for closing with update
